basic_info.name: 河南大学
basic_info.description: Henan University is a provincial public university in Henan, China, co-funded with the Ministry of Education. Established in 1912, it is a comprehensive university offering a wide range of disciplines and is part of the Double First-Class Construction initiative. It maintains campuses in both Kaifeng and Zhengzhou.
past_names: Henan Preparatory School for Studying in Europe and America
search_queries: Henan University official registered name English name
Henan University primary business sectors description

risk_analysis.finding_summary:
Henan University has multiple direct connections with the military and defense sector in China. The university operates a "People's Armed Force College" (人民武装学院), which was established under the co-supervision of the Henan Provincial Military Command and Henan University. This academy provides paramilitary management and basic military training to its students, with the explicit goal of fostering individuals with the "fine quality of soldiers". The unveiling ceremony for this academy in June 2001 was attended by leaders from the Provincial Military Command.

Furthermore, in January 2005, the General Staff Department of the Chinese People's Liberation Army (PLA) and Henan University formally signed an agreement for the joint training of military cadres (国防生). Under this agreement, selected students receive military-political training and an annual national defense scholarship of 5000 yuan.

More recently, Henan University's "Military-Civil Fusion Application Technology Research Institute" (军民融合应用技术研究院) was designated as one of the first batch of 10 Henan Provincial Military-Civil Fusion Development Think Tanks by the Henan Provincial Party Committee Military-Civil Fusion Development Committee Office. This highlights the university's direct involvement in military-civil fusion strategies and research. In September 2024, the General Military Training Medical Research Institute (全军军事训练医学研究所) and Henan University's School of Physical Education signed a strategic cooperation framework agreement to promote innovation in military training medicine and sports disciplines.

The university also has a People's Armed Forces Department (人民武装部) and a conscription work station (征兵工作站) responsible for student recruitment into the military. It actively integrates national defense education into its curriculum, including military training for students, and collaborates with various military units, such as the Strategic Support Force Information Engineering University, Airborne 128th Brigade, Kaifeng Military Sub-district, and Armed Police Kaifeng Detachment, as "national defense education co-construction units". Additionally, in 2016, Henan University was approved as a "Henan Province Military Transfer Cadre Training Base," providing training for military officers transitioning to civilian roles and vocational skills training for demobilized soldiers.

risk_analysis.finding_summary:
Henan University has established multiple direct and documented connections with military and defense-related entities in China. 

In January 2005, the General Staff Department of the Chinese People's Liberation Army (PLA) officially signed an agreement with Henan University for the joint training of military cadres. Following this, in October 2005, the university selected its first cohort of 'national defense students' (国防生) who received an annual national defense scholarship of 5,000 yuan from the military and underwent military-political training in addition to their academic studies.

Furthermore, on September 8, 2024, the All-Army Military Training Medical Research Institute (全军军事训练医学研究所) and Henan University's School of Physical Education formally entered into a strategic cooperation framework agreement. This collaboration aims to deepen civil-military integration, promoting the innovative development of military training medicine and sports disciplines through shared resources and complementary strengths.

Henan University also directly co-supervises the People's Arms Academy (人民武装学院), a college within the university. The unveiling ceremony for this academy in June 2001 was attended by leaders from the Henan Provincial Military Command.

Additionally, Henan University's Civil-Military Integration Application Technology Research Institute was approved as a Henan Provincial Civil-Military Integration Development Think Tank by the Henan Provincial Party Committee Civil-Military Integration Development Committee Office on September 26, 2024. The university also co-hosted an 'Advanced Technology Achievement Matching Activity' on June 7, 2024, organized by the Henan Provincial Party Committee Civil-Military Integration Office and the Henan Provincial Civil-Military Integration Development Research Institute. The university also cooperates with various military units, including the Information Engineering University of the Strategic Support Force, the 128th Airborne Brigade, Kaifeng Military Sub-district, and Kaifeng Armed Police Detachment, to establish 'co-construction units for national defense education' as of December 2020.
potential_intermediary_B: General Staff Department of the Chinese People's Liberation Army
All-Army Military Training Medical Research Institute
Henan Provincial Military Command
Henan Provincial Party Committee Civil-Military Integration Development Committee Office
Henan Provincial Civil-Military Integration Development Research Institute
Information Engineering University of the Strategic Support Force
128th Airborne Brigade
Kaifeng Military Sub-district
Kaifeng Armed Police Detachment

key_evidence.text: Following this, in October 2005, the university selected its first cohort of 'national defense students' (国防生) who received an annual national defense scholarship of 5,000 yuan from the military and underwent military-political training in addition to their academic studies.

This collaboration aims to deepen civil-military integration, promoting the innovative development of military training medicine and sports disciplines through shared resources and complementary strengths.
The unveiling ceremony for this academy in June 2001 was attended by leaders from the Henan Provincial Military Command.

\n\nAdditionally, Henan University's Civil-Military Integration Application Technology Research Institute was approved as a Henan Provincial Civil-Military Integration Development Think Tank by the Henan Provincial Party Committee Civil-Military Integration Development Committee Office on September 26, 2024.

The university also co-hosted an 'Advanced Technology Achievement Matching Activity' on June 7, 2024, organized by the Henan Provincial Party Committee Civil-Military Integration Office and the Henan Provincial Civil-Military Integration Development Research Institute.

The university also cooperates with various military units, including the Information Engineering University of the Strategic Support Force, the 128th Airborne Brigade, Kaifeng Military Sub-district, and Kaifeng Armed Police Detachment, to establish 'co-construction units for national defense education' as of December 2020.

risk_analysis.finding_summary:
Henan University, as one of the universities in Henan Province, is directly implicated in human rights violations related to religious freedom and academic autonomy. As recently as February 2025, reports indicate that "Henan Universities" (plural) have forced students to record anti-religion videos as a "political task," persecuting those who refuse. This includes mandatory attendance at anti-religion meetings, requirements to hand over phones, and prohibitions on photography, video recording, or online discussion of these meetings. Students whose videos are deemed unsatisfactory face further investigation, and dozens have reportedly experienced various forms of persecution. Universities are described as collaborating with the Chinese Communist Party (CCP) to investigate Christian students through these anti-religion videos.

Furthermore, in July 2017, new regulations in Henan province, announced by the provincial departments of education, public security, and foreign affairs, subjected international students attending universities in the province to censorship of their religious beliefs. These regulations banned students from practicing religious beliefs on campus and mandated courses in political theory, Chinese law, culture, and customs, effectively prohibiting religious gatherings or preaching on school property. These measures were identified as a "severe violation of Article 36 of the Constitution of the People's Republic of China". As a prominent university in Henan, Henan University would be subject to and implement these provincial directives.

Historically, Henan University has also been subject to significant political interference. In 1949, the Henan Provincial People's Government, under Chairman Wu Zhipu, "suppressed and split" Henan University for "various political reasons". Earlier, during the Chinese Civil War in 1948, the university faced political pressure, with its president, Yao Congwu, being compelled to relocate the institution south, leading to a split among its faculty and students. This demonstrates a long-standing pattern of direct state and political control over the university's operations and academic freedom.
potential_intermediary_B: Chinese Communist Party (CCP)
Henan Provincial People's Government
Henan Provincial Department of Education
Henan Provincial Department of Public Security
Henan Provincial Department of Foreign Affairs

risk_analysis.finding_summary: A thorough investigation into potential connections between Henan University (河南大学) and sanctions, including searches in both English and Chinese, did not yield any credible evidence of the university being directly or indirectly subject to sanctions or listed on any restricted party lists (e.g., U.S. Entity List, Unverified List, or similar international sanctions lists). While several search results discuss U.S. sanctions on various Chinese universities due to their involvement in high-tech research or military-related fields, these mentions specifically refer to other institutions, such as Luoyang Institute of Technology (洛阳理工学院) and Henan University of Science and Technology (河南科技大学). There were also discussions about academic misconduct and paper retractions involving institutions like Huaihe Hospital of Henan University and Henan Finance University, but these are distinct issues and not related to the 'sanctions' risk keyword in the context of export controls or restricted party designations. No specific contracts, collaborations, or official statements were found linking Henan University directly to any sanctions or export control restrictions.

risk_analysis.finding_summary: Henan University has direct connections to police technology through its Judicial Appraisal Center and a jointly established Cybersecurity Training Center. The Henan University Judicial Appraisal Center (河南大学司法鉴定中心), established in July 2004 and approved by the Henan Provincial Department of Justice, provides crucial forensic and trace evidence appraisal services. This center was designated by the Henan Provincial People's Government in September 2005 for medical re-appraisal in personal injury cases and for appraising criminals on medical parole. Its services include forensic pathology, forensic toxicology (ethanol detection), and traffic accident trace evidence appraisal, directly supporting law enforcement investigations. The center leverages the professional technical personnel and advanced equipment of Henan University and its First Affiliated Hospital. Furthermore, Henan University and 360 Digital Security Group officially launched a jointly established Cybersecurity Training Center. This collaboration aims to create a leading platform for cybersecurity demonstration and training in China, laying a solid foundation for digital security services in the central plains region. Cybersecurity is an increasingly vital component of modern police technology and operations.
potential_intermediary_B: Henan Provincial Department of Justice
360 Digital Security Group

key_evidence.text: Its services include forensic pathology, forensic toxicology (ethanol detection), and traffic accident trace evidence appraisal, directly supporting law enforcement investigations.
The center leverages the professional technical personnel and advanced equipment of Henan University and its First Affiliated Hospital.
This collaboration aims to create a leading platform for cybersecurity demonstration and training in China, laying a solid foundation for digital security services in the central plains region.

risk_analysis.finding_summary:
Henan University has direct and institutionalized connections with military and defense-related entities in China, indicating involvement in activities relevant to the 'weapons' risk keyword through personnel training, research, and technology transfer. 

Specifically, Henan University established a "School Of People's Arms Academy" (人民武装学院) under the co-supervision of the Henan Provincial Military Command and Henan University. This academy, unveiled in June 2001 with attendance from provincial military leaders, provides paramilitary management and basic military training to its students, who have also participated in and won military training performances for college students. The academy also publishes the "People's Arms Academy Learned Journal."

Furthermore, Henan University's "Military-Civil Fusion Application Technology Research Institute" (军民融合应用技术研究院) was designated as one of the first 10 Henan Provincial Military-Civil Fusion Development Think Tanks in September 2024, making it the sole vocational college in the province to receive this recognition. In June 2024, the university hosted an "Advanced Technology Achievement Matching Activity" organized by the Henan Provincial Party Committee's Military-Civil Fusion Office. This event aimed to facilitate the transfer of the university's scientific and technological innovations, particularly in new materials, information technology, and intelligent manufacturing, to foster "new quality productive forces" and support technological self-reliance, which often includes dual-use technologies applicable to defense.

In January 2005, the General Staff Department of the Chinese People's Liberation Army (PLA) formally signed an agreement with Henan University for the joint training of military officers. As part of this program, national defense students (国防生) at Henan University received military and political training, including military psychology, military law, military leadership science, and basic military skills, along with an annual national defense scholarship from the military. The university also has a People's Armed Forces Department and a conscription station, actively participating in student conscription and sending off new recruits.

Additionally, the Henan Key Laboratory of Big Data Analysis and Processing at Henan University collaborates with the Administration of Science, Technology and Industry for National Defense of Henan Province and China Electronics Technology Group Corporation on remote sensing data programs, which can have dual-use applications for military intelligence. A strategic cooperation agreement was also signed in September 2024 between the General Military Training Medical Research Institute and Henan University's School of Physical Education to advance military training medicine and sports disciplines within the framework of military-civil fusion.
potential_intermediary_B: Henan Provincial Military Command
General Staff Department of the Chinese People's Liberation Army
Henan Provincial Party Committee's Military-Civil Fusion Office
General Military Training Medical Research Institute
Administration of Science, Technology and Industry for National Defense of Henan Province
China Electronics Technology Group Corporation

key_evidence.text: \n\nFurthermore, Henan University's \"Military-Civil Fusion Application Technology Research Institute\" (军民融合应用技术研究院) was designated as one of the first 10 Henan Provincial Military-Civil Fusion Development Think Tanks in September 2024, making it the sole vocational college in the province to receive this recognition.

This event aimed to facilitate the transfer of the university's scientific and technological innovations, particularly in new materials, information technology, and intelligent manufacturing, to foster \"new quality productive forces\" and support technological self-reliance, which often includes dual-use technologies applicable to defense.

As part of this program, national defense students (国防生) at Henan University received military and political training, including military psychology, military law, military leadership science, and basic military skills, along with an annual national defense scholarship from the military.
The university also has a People's Armed Forces Department and a conscription station, actively participating in student conscription and sending off new recruits.

\n\nAdditionally, the Henan Key Laboratory of Big Data Analysis and Processing at Henan University collaborates with the Administration of Science, Technology and Industry for National Defense of Henan Province and China Electronics Technology Group Corporation on remote sensing data programs, which can have dual-use applications for military intelligence.

A strategic cooperation agreement was also signed in September 2024 between the General Military Training Medical Research Institute and Henan University's School of Physical Education to advance military training medicine and sports disciplines within the framework of military-civil fusion.

risk_analysis.finding_summary: No credible evidence was found to establish direct or indirect connections between Henan University and terrorist activities or organizations. The university has been noted for its participation in anti-terrorism awareness campaigns, such as the 'Anti-Terrorism Propaganda and Education into Campus' event in Kaifeng City in December 2020. Other search results discuss broader counter-terrorism efforts in China, including the establishment of anti-terrorism programs at other institutions, but these do not implicate Henan University in supporting terrorism. It is crucial to distinguish 'Henan University' (河南大学) from 'Henan University of Science and Technology' (河南科技大学), which is a different institution. Irrelevant mentions of 'extremism' or other universities were also noted but did not provide any links to Henan University regarding the specified risk keyword.

key_evidence.text: For instance, in December 2020, Henan University participated in the "Anti-Terrorism Propaganda and Education into Campus" activity in Kaifeng City, alongside other local universities and government departments, to promote understanding of China's Anti-Terrorism Law.

*   **Broader Counter-Terrorism Context in China**: Several search results discuss China's national efforts to combat terrorism and extremism, including the establishment of counter-terrorism specializations and research centers at other Chinese universities, such as the People's Public Security University of China and Northwest University of Political Science and Law.

*   **Distinction from Other Institutions**: It is important to note that "Henan University" (河南大学) should not be confused with "Henan University of Science and Technology" (河南科技大学), which is mentioned in ASPI's China Defence Universities Tracker as having defence links.

The investigation specifically focused on "Henan University."
*   **Irrelevant Mentions**: Other search results touched upon general discussions of "extremism" in a national security context in China
, or unrelated topics such as "green terror" in Taiwan's political discourse
, or a US federal investigation into the University of Michigan regarding "Chinese Bio-Terrorism Connect"
